episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including the display of camels in 18th century London, the testing of trains in Austria, the origins of the Shell oil company, and a peculiar incident involving Mozart's performance in Naples.

facts.fact: In 1758, there were two camels on display in London, one with a single hump and one with two humps. They were advertised as the surprising camel and the wonderful camel.
Before they are launched, London sends all its trains to Austria to be beaten up.
The oil company Shell used to sell shells.
When Mozart first performed in Naples, he had to stop to take his ring off halfway through because the audience complained it was a magic ring.
